channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Box of medical(?) waste left on street, 12th January
item.description:
A card box box full of used gloves, packs of wipes etc left on street corner some time today 12/01.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, Greater London

item.title: Tree Root issue, 12th January
item.description:
A Public Tree root is Causing damage to driveway which may be taken up and replaced - this will reveal roots if they are the problem. Will you come and divert roots? What are the next steps.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Howards Crest Close, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Concrete lump on pavement - trip hazard -, 12th January
item.description:
My elderly mother tripped over the lump in the pavement outside Tesco in ballards lane on 11/1/26 she was helped by passers by and managed to get home. Today she has a sore knee which needs strapping and paracetamol to reduce pain. She has asked me to report it so no one else hurts themselves. Concrete lump on the paving caused the trip.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21-29, Ballards Lane, Church End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep and dangerous pothole cannot avoid, 12th January
item.description:
Pothole is in the left lane after turning left into Gloucester Road from Lyonsdown Road. The pothole is deep and dangerous and cannot be seen in the dark. It is towards the right hand side of the left lane and my car went down into the pothole even at a low speed as it’s soon after turning into the road and 20 mph speed limit. This urgently needs repairing to prevent damage or injury to vehicles or cyclists.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, New Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fox has passed away, 12th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Monteagle Way, Hackney, London

item.title: Fly tipping and bin rubbish due to overflowing bins, 12th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ferry Place, Woolwich

item.title: URGENT- Dog waste for removal - public walkway between Selborne Road and Allendale Close by the barriers, 12th January
item.description:
URGENT- Dog waste - public walkway between Selborne Road and Allendale Close by the barriers for urgent removal please. This is a public walkway used by children and vulnerable adults alike. We would be grateful if you could give this your earliest attention for removal please. Thanks so much.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66-71, Allendale Close, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Human Waste - raw sewage, 12th January
item.description:
I live in Lockyer estate. JMB leatherhead service my block. I have reported human sewage on my doorstep to them over seven times (email phone and in person ) since November. They assure me they will fix it but nothing has been done. I cannot keep living with sewage outside my house it is unsanitary. I have spoken to my landlord but as it is outside the property JmB are responsible

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kipling Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle left opposite junction, unlocked, someone has opened the car and left door ajar encouraging theft or joy riding., 12th January
item.description:
Car left unlocked encouraging theft or joy riding etc. Vehicle came from Princess Alice car park where it was parked illegally. Constructors left flyers to ask for cars to be moved before fencing off the area. Car hasn’t moved since which has to be several months

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Delisle Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet
